The start date of Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, which has been cited as the catalyst for a broader wave of alleged Russian hybrid warfare operations across Europe.

A key period during which several European countries independently uncovered espionage and sabotage networks, including in Lithuania, Latvia, and Poland.

keyTakeAways: Poland has arrested eight individuals, including three Ukrainian nationals, suspected of espionage and planning sabotage, such as sending explosive packages to intimidate populations and destabilize EU nations supporting Ukraine.

The arrests are part of a broader pattern of alleged Russian hybrid warfare, with Poland, Romania, Lithuania, Latvia, and the UK accusing Moscow of orchestrating sabotage and spy networks targeting European countries.

Romania’s intelligence services intercepted a network involving Ukrainian nationals who allegedly coordinated explosive package deliveries via international delivery services, under Russian coordination.
Poland has arrested 55 people over the past three years for suspected espionage and sabotage, all charged under Article 130 of its penal code.
Several European countries, including the UK, have reported similar operations, indicating a coordinated and widespread threat to EU security.
The European Union is proposing a 'drone wall' to counter increasing drone incursions across eastern borders, reflecting growing concerns over aerial threats in the context of hybrid warfare.
Denmark and Germany experienced airport closures due to drone incursions, highlighting the tangible impact of these attacks on civilian infrastructure and public safety.
Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk has called for urgent upgrades to Poland’s air defenses following drone attacks, and has emphasized the onset of a hybrid war against Europe.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Poland has arrested eight individuals, including three Ukrainian nationals, on suspicion of espionage and sabotage, including sending explosive packages to intimidate populations and destabilize EU nations supporting Ukraine. The arrests come amid broader accusations that Russia is conducting a hybrid war across Europe, involving espionage, sabotage, and drone incursions. Romanian intelligence services identified a coordinated effort involving Ukrainian citizens under Russian direction, with explosive packages delivered via international delivery services. Poland has arrested 55 people over three years under Article 130 of its penal code, which covers espionage and sabotage. Similar incidents have been reported in Lithuania, Latvia, the UK, and other EU countries, suggesting a coordinated Russian campaign. Drone incursions across Belgium, Denmark, and Germany have caused disruptions and prompted the EU to propose a 'drone wall' on eastern borders. Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk has pledged urgent upgrades to air defenses, and European leaders warn of an escalating hybrid war against Europe.
title: Poland arrests suspected saboteurs amid fears of Russian ‘hybrid warfare’
